# IINA Plugin Bookmarks Documentation

> Bookmark management system for IINA media player
> https://iina-plugin-bookmarks.w4w.dev

## Overview

IINA Plugin Bookmarks is a production-ready bookmark management plugin for the IINA media player on macOS. It provides intelligent media title detection, advanced filtering and search, cloud synchronization, and comprehensive data management with import/export capabilities.

## Documentation Structure

### Getting Started
- Home: /docs
  Overview of the plugin, key features, quick start guide, and core concepts

### Features
- Bookmark Management: /docs/features/bookmark-management
  Advanced bookmark operations including create, update, delete, batch operations, performance optimizations, and caching

- Media Title Detection: /docs/features/media-detection
  Intelligent media title detection with auto-detection from metadata, filename cleaning, and smart fallback logic

- Advanced Filtering & Search: /docs/features/filtering
  Comprehensive filtering system with text search, multi-select filters, date ranges, advanced search syntax, filter presets, and analytics

- Multi-Criteria Sorting: /docs/features/sorting
  Flexible sorting with multiple criteria, priority-based ordering, custom sort functions, and persistent preferences

- Data Management: /docs/features/data-management
  Export/import system supporting JSON and CSV formats with validation, batch processing, and error handling

### API Reference
- BookmarkManager API: /docs/api/bookmark-manager
  Complete API reference for the BookmarkManager class including all public methods, properties, and event handlers

- Interfaces & Types: /docs/api/interfaces
  Complete TypeScript interface definitions and type declarations for Bookmark, Filter, SortConfig, CloudSyncConfig, and other core types

### Development
- Architecture: /docs/development/architecture
  Technical architecture including core components, data flow, state management, caching strategy, and event system

- Contributing Guide: /docs/development/contributing
  How to contribute to the project including setup, development workflow, testing, code style, and pull request process

- Implementation Notes: /docs/development/implementation-notes
  Detailed technical implementation notes for key features including performance optimizations, error handling, and design decisions

## Key Capabilities

- **Bookmark Management**: Create, edit, delete, and organize bookmarks with tags, descriptions, and thumbnails
- **Intelligent Detection**: Auto-detect media titles from metadata with smart fallback to filename cleaning
- **Advanced Search**: Full-text search with boolean operators, field-specific queries, and filter presets
- **Cloud Sync**: Synchronize bookmarks across devices using cloud storage (WebDAV, S3, Google Drive, Dropbox)
- **Import/Export**: Export bookmarks to JSON or CSV; import with validation and conflict resolution
- **Performance**: High-performance caching, debounced operations, and optimized rendering
- **Accessibility**: ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support throughout UI
- **Testing**: Comprehensive test suite with unit tests, integration tests, and CI/CD automation

## Technology Stack

- TypeScript 5.8
- IINA Plugin API (JavaScriptCore environment)
- UI: WKWebView with React 19 components
- Build: Parcel bundler with custom optimizer
- Testing: Vitest with comprehensive coverage
- CI/CD: GitHub Actions with automated releases

## Plugin Integration

The plugin integrates with IINA through:
- Event system for player state changes
- Core API for seeking and playback control
- UI interfaces (sidebar, overlay, window)
- Network API for cloud sync operations
- Storage API for local data persistence

## Use Cases

- Quick navigation within long videos using timestamped bookmarks
- Organizing reference points across multiple media files
- Syncing bookmarks between multiple machines
- Exporting bookmark data for analysis or backup
- Batch operations on large bookmark collections

## Version

Current version: 1.0.0 (Production-ready)
Last updated: February 2026
